div.p: Our Lelius, an eyewitness of all that was done in the assemblies of the kingdom, has freed me from a long writing: if I were to write what he reports, I would be doing what has already been done and burdening you with unnecessary work. Regarding my own situation, I have nothing certain to write.

The hope that keeps me here is as well known to Lelius as it is to me. Therefore, omitting these, I greet you reverently and pray to the best and greatest God for all happiness for you and all yours. If the Lord begins to act in the cause of religion, I will make sure that it becomes known to you.

I know, my Bullinger, how much I owe you, I remember the services with which you have treated me both in absence and in presence; therefore, be assured that Lismanini is very much yours. My wife reverently greets you and your most holy wife and your most honorable daughters. Farewell.
To the most learned and of exceptional piety, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful pastor of the Church of Zürich, much respected lord and brother. In Zürich.
